discovery_rule.name: Cluster Service Network Reconnections Discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovers nodes in the network reconnections monitor.

item_prototype.name: Cluster Network Reconnections {#CLUSSVCNETREC} Normal Message Queue Length
item_prototype.key: perf_counter["\Cluster Network Reconnections({#CLUSSVCNETREC})\Normal Message Queue Length",300]

item_prototype.name: Cluster Network Reconnections {#CLUSSVCNETREC} Unacknowledged Message Queue Length
Cluster Network Reconnections {#CLUSSVCNETREC} Urgent Message Queue Length
item_prototype.key: perf_counter["\Cluster Network Reconnections({#CLUSSVCNETREC})\Urgent Message Queue Length",300]

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template OS Windows Cluster Services:perf_counter["\Cluster Network Reconnections({#CLUSSVCNETREC})\Normal Message Queue Length",300].last()}>1
trigger_prototype.name: {#CLUSSVCNETREC}) Normal Message Queue Length
trigger_prototype.description: Monitors how many messages are sitting in the queue and waiting to be sent. Normally this number is 0, but if TCP connection breaks you might observe it is going up until TCP connection is reestablished and we can send all of them through.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template OS Windows Cluster Services:perf_counter["\Cluster Network Reconnections({#CLUSSVCNETREC})\Unacknowledged Message Queue Length",300].last()}>1
trigger_prototype.name: {#CLUSSVCNETREC}) Unacknowledged Message Queue Length
trigger_prototype.description: Monitors how many messages are sitting in the queue and waiting to be sent. Normally this number is 0, but if TCP connection breaks you might observe it is going up until TCP connection is reestablished and we can send all of them through.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template OS Windows Cluster Services:perf_counter["\Cluster Network Reconnections({#CLUSSVCNETREC})\Urgent Message Queue Length",300].last()}>1
trigger_prototype.name: {#CLUSSVCNETREC}) Urgent Message Queue Length
trigger_prototype.description: Monitors how many messages are sitting in the queue and waiting to be sent. Normally this number is 0, but if TCP connection breaks you might observe it is going up until TCP connection is reestablished and we can send all of them through.

trigger.description: Monitors the number of messages in the Database update queue.
